title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper along with the authors' names.

extractions.description: The paper presents a method for robot navigation using a sampling-based graph building process to create sparser graphs with higher navigation performance. It introduces strategies for graph maintenance to remove spurious edges and expand the graph, enhancing lifelong navigation performance. The method involves training a model using simulated data and fine-tuning it with real-world data to improve navigational accuracy over time.

type.justification: The study includes experiments and results from simulation environments and real-world applications to validate the proposed navigation model.
type.quote: We compare our method against SPTM [6] and ViNG [8]... and compare the navigation success rates in both simulated and real-world environments.

name.justification: The research focuses on topological navigation for robots, an application within the field of vision-based robot navigation.
name.quote: Index Terms—Vision-Based Navigation, Deep Learning for Visual Perception

name.justification: The use of Deep Learning for visual perception is a key component in the navigation approach discussed.
name.quote: Index Terms—Vision-Based Navigation, Deep Learning for Visual Perception

name.justification: SPTM is mentioned as one of the existing methods for image-goal navigation tasks.
name.quote: More closely related to our approach are semi-parametric topological memory (SPTM) [6] and visual navigation with goals (ViNG) [8].

is_contributed.justification: SPTM is used for comparison purposes rather than being a contribution.
is_contributed.quote: More closely related to our approach are semi-parametric topological memory (SPTM) [6] and visual navigation with goals (ViNG) [8].

is_executed.justification: The model is not executed within the paper but is rather used as a baseline for comparison.
is_executed.quote: We compare our method against SPTM [6] and ViNG [8]...

is_compared.justification: SPTM's navigation performance is discussed in comparison to the proposed model.
is_compared.quote: We compare our method against SPTM [6] and ViNG [8]...

name.justification: The Gibson environment is used to generate training datasets and to evaluate navigation performance in simulation.
